intro: Acmella decumbens, commonly known as the spiny sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive central disc, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Acmella decumbens is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
